intro: Garcinia tschapensis, commonly known as the African yellow mangosteen, is a tropical evergreen tree native to central and western Africa. It belongs to the family Clusiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, dark-barked trunk and dense, glossy green leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by elliptical, red or yellow berries. Its fruits are highly valued for their medicinal properties and are used in traditional medicine to treat various ailments. The plant also plays an important ecological role in its native habitats by providing food and shelter for wildlife.
